eu_initiatives:
CNI is deeply involved in projects, study and proposals (both at national and european level) concerning the following main arguments: 
- regulation of profession 
- mutual recognition of professional qualifications 
- public procurement legislation 
- common training principles 
- professional education and traineeship 
- access to and pursuit of the profession 
- other matters related to the engineering profession or, in general, to regulated professions
section: VI - Organisations representing local, regional and municipal authorities, other public or mixed entities, etc.
subsection: Other public or mixed entities, created by law whose purpose is to act in the public interest

goals__remit: The Consiglio Nazionale Ingegneri (CNI - National Council of Engineers) is an association set up by public law for the purpose of overseeing the organisation of the engineering profession at a national level. It operates under the jurisdiction of the Ministry of Justice. Its headquaters are located in Rome. As an institution, the CNI acts as a consultant to both Parliament and the Government on matters concerning the practice of the profession and, in general, problems related to the engineering field. The organisation carries out this duty by drawing up proposals of law or regulations concerning the engineering profession.
relevant_communication:
CNI is a member of several national, international and european organizations (mainly representing the interests of the engineering profession), such as FEANI, ECCE, ECEC, CEPLIS, EAMC (Engineering Association of the Mediterranean Countries).  
Within these organizations, CNI has participated to different EC studies/projects, such as, recently, ECEC study on "Common Training Principles for Engineers", still under implementation by the relevant Association.
legal_status: Ente pubblico non economico - public authority
